H0.text: pH is the factor the Raleigh man used to evaluate the safety of the water when he turned on his kitchen faucet, filled a glass, suspected it might not be safe to drink, and called the water company.

H1.text: Turbidity is the factor that the Raleigh man used to evaluate the safety of the water he filled in a glass from his kitchen faucet.

H2.text: Nitrate concentration is the factor the Raleigh man used to evaluate the safety of the water he filled in a glass from his kitchen faucet after suspecting it might not be safe to drink and calling the water company.

H3.text: Phosphate concentration is the factor the Raleigh man used to evaluate the safety of the water he filled from his kitchen faucet and then called the water company about.

A4.text: The higher the turbidity level, the higher the risk that people may develop gastrointestinal diseases.

A5.text: Suspended solids interfere with water disinfection with chlorine because the particles act as shields for viruses and bacteria.
